{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Location Manager",
  "description": "Food online is a people-centric online food delivery startup committed to satisfying your cravings and stomach demands within the shortest time.&nbsp;We connect you to your favorite Local restaurants, Craving spots and chefs delivering directly to doorsteps.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Location Manager
Job Locations:&nbsp;Akwa Ibom, Delta, Enugu, Lagos and Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Are you passionate about business development and sales?
	Do you have what it takes to drive partnerships and build impactful relationships?
	We&#39;re looking for dynamic business development sales professionals from Oyo, Delta and Uyo to join our team of fast-paced Sales executives


Application Closing Date
31st October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to:&nbsp;foodonlinehr@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Business Location Manager&quot; as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",

Business Location Manager Job at Food Online




        
    

        
        Food online is a people-centric online food delivery startup committed to satisfying your cravings and stomach demands within the shortest time. We connect you to your favorite Local restaurants, Craving spots and chefs delivering directly to doorsteps.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Location Manager
Job Locations: Akwa Ibom, Delta, Enugu, Lagos and Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Are you passionate about business development and sales?
	Do you have what it takes to drive partnerships and build impactful relationships?
	We're looking for dynamic business development sales professionals from Oyo, Delta and Uyo to join our team of fast-paced Sales executives


Application Closing Date
31st October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: foodonlinehr@gmail.com using "Business Location Manager" as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Cashier",
  "description": "Lily Hospitals Limited, established since 1986, remains one of the foremost hospitals in Nigeria and within the South-South region of the country. It is the first private hospital in Nigeria to achieve ISO 9001:2000 quality management system certification from the Standards Organization of Nigeria (SON) and was also recently accredited with COHSASA (Council for Health Service Accreditation of Southern Africa) Certificate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier
Job Location:&nbsp;Warri, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Cashier. As a Cashier, you will be responsible for handling various financial transactions, maintaining accurate records.
	The ideal candidate should possess excellent organizational skills, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to maintaining confidentiality.


Key Responsibilities


	Post customer payments by recording cash, cheque, and credit/debit card transactions on the accounting software.
	Maintain a comprehensive record of all cash, cheque, and credit/debit card transactions for future reference.
	Manage an accurate and up-to-date hospital income record by handling bank cheques and documenting relevant transactions.
	Ensure proper documentation of handovers of cash, cheques, and POS printouts.
	Prepare regular (weekly) cash flow reports for management review when required.
	Maintain confidentiality of all patients&#39; and hospital&#39;s financial information.
	Manage petty cash and disbursements.
	Issue receipts to patients for services rendered by the organization.
	Accurately credit client/patient accounts and debit the cash or cheque control account on the Accounting software.
	Record accounting transactions on the financial reporting software and conduct bank reconciliations.
	Lodge cash and cheques into corporate accounts as needed.
	Safely keep custody of cash and cheques received until bank lodgment.
	Ensure the good working condition of POS, cash safe, and other relevant tools used for the role.


The Person


	Minimum academic qualification of an ND in Business, Finance, Accounting, Economics, or any related degree.
	Minimum of 1-year of relevant work experience.
	Excellent customer service skills.
	Working knowledge of accounting and financial concepts and practices.
	Full working knowledge of the Microsoft Office package, especially with spreadsheet software (Excel).
	Excellent communication and people management skills.
	Exceptional oral, written, and presentation skills are required for this role.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@lilyhospitals.net&nbsp;using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the mail.

Note:&nbsp;Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-13",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Cashier Job at Lily Hospitals Limited




        
    

        
        Lily Hospitals Limited, established since 1986, remains one of the foremost hospitals in Nigeria and within the South-South region of the country. It is the first private hospital in Nigeria to achieve ISO 9001:2000 quality management system certification from the Standards Organization of Nigeria (SON) and was also recently accredited with COHSASA (Council for Health Service Accreditation of Southern Africa) Certificate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier
Job Location: Warri, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Cashier. As a Cashier, you will be responsible for handling various financial transactions, maintaining accurate records.
	The ideal candidate should possess excellent organizational skills, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to maintaining confidentiality.


Key Responsibilities


	Post customer payments by recording cash, cheque, and credit/debit card transactions on the accounting software.
	Maintain a comprehensive record of all cash, cheque, and credit/debit card transactions for future reference.
	Manage an accurate and up-to-date hospital income record by handling bank cheques and documenting relevant transactions.
	Ensure proper documentation of handovers of cash, cheques, and POS printouts.
	Prepare regular (weekly) cash flow reports for management review when required.
	Maintain confidentiality of all patients' and hospital's financial information.
	Manage petty cash and disbursements.
	Issue receipts to patients for services rendered by the organization.
	Accurately credit client/patient accounts and debit the cash or cheque control account on the Accounting software.
	Record accounting transactions on the financial reporting software and conduct bank reconciliations.
	Lodge cash and cheques into corporate accounts as needed.
	Safely keep custody of cash and cheques received until bank lodgment.
	Ensure the good working condition of POS, cash safe, and other relevant tools used for the role.


The Person


	Minimum academic qualification of an ND in Business, Finance, Accounting, Economics, or any related degree.
	Minimum of 1-year of relevant work experience.
	Excellent customer service skills.
	Working knowledge of accounting and financial concepts and practices.
	Full working knowledge of the Microsoft Office package, especially with spreadsheet software (Excel).
	Excellent communication and people management skills.
	Exceptional oral, written, and presentation skills are required for this role.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@lilyhospitals.net using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Medical Officer",
  "description": "Lily Hospitals Limited, established since 1986, remains one of the foremost hospitals in Nigeria and within the South-South region of the country. It is the first private hospital in Nigeria to achieve ISO 9001:2000 quality management system certification from the Standards Organization of Nigeria (SON) and was also recently accredited with COHSASA (Council for Health Service Accreditation of Southern Africa) Certificate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Officer&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Woji, Port Harcourt - Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)
Experience level:&nbsp;Intermediate

Job Summary


	This role is responsible for performing inpatient and outpatient care, providing necessary documentation on health reports and discharge summaries of patients.
	Liaising with consultants regarding the provision of inpatient and outpatient care including diagnosis and medication plans.


What you will be doing


	To provide quality medical care to patients under the supervision of the HOD, Consultants and other senior medical staff.
	Performing administrative duties and risk management.
	Analyze records, reports, test results or examine patients to diagnose medical conditions that are complex and refer to appropriate consultants for further care.
	Assist consultants in performing cesarean sections or other surgical procedures as needed to preserve patient&rsquo;s health.
	To ensure comprehensive, accurate and concise medical records are collected and maintained for patients with an appropriate signed and dated legible entry in the patient&rsquo;s medical record on every attendance upon a patient.
	Contribute to quality patient care by participating in case planning which includes appropriate pre-admission planning, in-hospital care and discharge planning.
	To arrange investigations, medical treatment and discharge as directed by the Senior Registrars or Consultant to which assigned.
	To be &quot;on-call&quot; or participate in shift rosters is a requirement of the position.


Qualifications


	Candidate must be licensed to practice medicine from the Nigerian Medical and Dental Association of Nigeria.
	1-3 years of experience as a Medical Officer.
	Candidate must possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Medicine and surgery.
	Candidates must be Knowledgeable in General Medicine and other related areas of medical practice.
	Must have valuable sympathetic bedside manners, strong active listening skills and advanced problem-solving abilities while being able to work in a team.
	Candidate must possess excellent communication skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@lilyhospitals.net&nbsp;using &quot;Medical Officer&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

Medical Officer Job at Lily Hospitals Limited




        
    

        
        Lily Hospitals Limited, established since 1986, remains one of the foremost hospitals in Nigeria and within the South-South region of the country. It is the first private hospital in Nigeria to achieve ISO 9001:2000 quality management system certification from the Standards Organization of Nigeria (SON) and was also recently accredited with COHSASA (Council for Health Service Accreditation of Southern Africa) Certificate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Officer 

Job Location: Woji, Port Harcourt - Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)
Experience level: Intermediate

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This role is responsible for performing inpatient and outpatient care, providing necessary documentation on health reports and discharge summaries of patients.
	Liaising with consultants regarding the provision of inpatient and outpatient care including diagnosis and medication plans.


What you will be doing


	To provide quality medical care to patients under the supervision of the HOD, Consultants and other senior medical staff.
	Performing administrative duties and risk management.
	Analyze records, reports, test results or examine patients to diagnose medical conditions that are complex and refer to appropriate consultants for further care.
	Assist consultants in performing cesarean sections or other surgical procedures as needed to preserve patient’s health.
	To ensure comprehensive, accurate and concise medical records are collected and maintained for patients with an appropriate signed and dated legible entry in the patient’s medical record on every attendance upon a patient.
	Contribute to quality patient care by participating in case planning which includes appropriate pre-admission planning, in-hospital care and discharge planning.
	To arrange investigations, medical treatment and discharge as directed by the Senior Registrars or Consultant to which assigned.
	To be "on-call" or participate in shift rosters is a requirement of the position.


Qualifications


	Candidate must be licensed to practice medicine from the Nigerian Medical and Dental Association of Nigeria.
	1-3 years of experience as a Medical Officer.
	Candidate must possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Medicine and surgery.
	Candidates must be Knowledgeable in General Medicine and other related areas of medical practice.
	Must have valuable sympathetic bedside manners, strong active listening skills and advanced problem-solving abilities while being able to work in a team.
	Candidate must possess excellent communication skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@lilyhospitals.net using "Medical Officer" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Journalist",
  "description": "The Nigerian Navy (NN) is a branch of the Nigerian Armed Forces. It is among the largest navies on the African continent, consisting of several thousand personnel, including those of the Coast Guard.

Applications are invited from qualified Nigerians for special enlistment into the Nigerian Navy Basic Training School (NNBTS) Batch 38 within the capacity below:

Job Position: Journalist

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria

Educational Requirements


	
	Minimum of OND Lower Credit in Mass Communication, Journalism, Photography, Printing Technology, Information Library, Public Relations, Graphic Arts, Film Making or Cinematography and must also possess SSCE or equivalent with 5 credits including English Language and Mathematics.
	


Application Guidelines / General Qualifications


	Applicant must be a citizen of Nigeria by birth (No dual citizenship allowed).
	Applicants must be between ages of 18 - 26 years by 31 December 2025.
	Applicants with additional qualifications such as OND and NCE etc are to provide&nbsp;their statement of results.
	Applicants must not be married, pregnant or nursing.
	Applicants must be free from any previous criminal conviction by a court of law.
	Applicants with any of the following medical/physical challenges are NOT to&nbsp;apply: sight problem, ear problem, communicable diseases, mental problems,&nbsp;stammering, or any physical disability. Others are BMI, flat foot, dental health and spinal&nbsp;deformities. Applicants who have tattoos are also not to apply.
	Applicants must not be below the height of 1.68 meters for males and 1.65 meters&nbsp;for females.
	Applicants are required to possess any of the following educational/professional&nbsp;qualifications:
	
		West African Senior School Certificate Examination Certificate (not more
		than 2 sittings and not older than 6 years from the date of application, also
		applicable to sub paragraphs b &ndash; e).
		General Certificate of Education Ordinary Level.
		National Examination Council (NECO).
		National Business and Technical Examinations (NABTEB).
		WAEC City and Guilds or London City and Guild.
		Ordinary National Diploma (OND).
		Any other educational qualification equivalent to those mentioned above.
		Applicants would be required to produce their primary school leaving&nbsp;certificate at the selection interview.
	
	
	All applicants must indicate/provide their National Identification Number (NIN).
	Applicants with other educational/professional qualifications (HND and&nbsp;equivalent) higher than those stated in paragraph 8 (a-g) are not to apply.
	Certificates or qualifications not declared or tendered and accepted during the&nbsp;recruitment exercise are not acceptable after recruitment and cannot be tendered for the&nbsp;purpose of change of department or advancement while already in the Nigerian Navy.
	Only qualifications obtained under proper service provisions are acceptable while in the&nbsp;Nigerian Navy.
	Applicants are required to print out Applicant&rsquo;s Declaration Form,&nbsp;Parent/Guardian Consent Form, Local Government Area Certification Form, Police
	Certification Form and Guarantors Form which must be properly completed, endorsed&nbsp;and presented during the interview.
	Applicants must come to the recruitment centres with the following documents:
	
		Photocopies of Birth Certificate or Age Declaration.
		Photocopies of Credentials including First School Leaving
		Certificate/Testimonial.
		Duly completed Identification Form must be signed by Chairman or Secretary of the Applicant&rsquo;s LGA or by an officer of the rank of Commander and above (or equivalent in the Nigerian Army and Nigerian Air Force) or Chief Superintendent of Police (CSP) and above who hails from the Applicant&rsquo;s State of Origin.
		Duly completed Parent/Guardian Consent Form signed by Applicant&rsquo;s Parent or Guardian.
		Four (4) passport photographs duly signed and stamped at the back by (c) above.
		Candidates are to bring the scratch cards of their WAEC, GCE, NECO and NABTEB results to the recruitment centres.
	
	
	Application Form is to be completed and submitted online.
	Applicant must not be bonded to any secret society or unlawful organizations.
	Any applicant suspected or confirmed to have impersonated, falsified, forged or
	presented false document(s) shall be disqualified from the Recruitment exercise and handed over to the appropriate law enforcement agency for prosecution.
	Recruitment Aptitude Test will hold on 29 November 2025.
	Successful applicants will undergo basic military training and on completion will
	be enlisted into the service of the Nigerian Navy as Ordinary Seaman
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-02",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "NIGERIAN NAVY"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "188213"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Journalist Job at the Nigerian Navy




        
    

        
        The Nigerian Navy (NN) is a branch of the Nigerian Armed Forces. It is among the largest navies on the African continent, consisting of several thousand personnel, including those of the Coast Guard.

Applications are invited from qualified Nigerians for special enlistment into the Nigerian Navy Basic Training School (NNBTS) Batch 38 within the capacity below:

Job Position: Journalist

Job Location: Nigeria

Educational Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	
	Minimum of OND Lower Credit in Mass Communication, Journalism, Photography, Printing Technology, Information Library, Public Relations, Graphic Arts, Film Making or Cinematography and must also possess SSCE or equivalent with 5 credits including English Language and Mathematics.
	


Application Guidelines / General Qualifications


	Applicant must be a citizen of Nigeria by birth (No dual citizenship allowed).
	Applicants must be between ages of 18 - 26 years by 31 December 2025.
	Applicants with additional qualifications such as OND and NCE etc are to provide their statement of results.
	Applicants must not be married, pregnant or nursing.
	Applicants must be free from any previous criminal conviction by a court of law.
	Applicants with any of the following medical/physical challenges are NOT to apply: sight problem, ear problem, communicable diseases, mental problems, stammering, or any physical disability. Others are BMI, flat foot, dental health and spinal deformities. Applicants who have tattoos are also not to apply.
	Applicants must not be below the height of 1.68 meters for males and 1.65 meters for females.
	Applicants are required to possess any of the following educational/professional qualifications:
	
		West African Senior School Certificate Examination Certificate (not more
		than 2 sittings and not older than 6 years from the date of application, also
		applicable to sub paragraphs b – e).
		General Certificate of Education Ordinary Level.
		National Examination Council (NECO).
		National Business and Technical Examinations (NABTEB).
		WAEC City and Guilds or London City and Guild.
		Ordinary National Diploma (OND).
		Any other educational qualification equivalent to those mentioned above.
		Applicants would be required to produce their primary school leaving certificate at the selection interview.
	
	
	All applicants must indicate/provide their National Identification Number (NIN).
	Applicants with other educational/professional qualifications (HND and equivalent) higher than those stated in paragraph 8 (a-g) are not to apply.
	Certificates or qualifications not declared or tendered and accepted during the recruitment exercise are not acceptable after recruitment and cannot be tendered for the purpose of change of department or advancement while already in the Nigerian Navy.
	Only qualifications obtained under proper service provisions are acceptable while in the Nigerian Navy.
	Applicants are required to print out Applicant’s Declaration Form, Parent/Guardian Consent Form, Local Government Area Certification Form, Police
	Certification Form and Guarantors Form which must be properly completed, endorsed and presented during the interview.
	Applicants must come to the recruitment centres with the following documents:
	
		Photocopies of Birth Certificate or Age Declaration.
		Photocopies of Credentials including First School Leaving
		Certificate/Testimonial.
		Duly completed Identification Form must be signed by Chairman or Secretary of the Applicant’s LGA or by an officer of the rank of Commander and above (or equivalent in the Nigerian Army and Nigerian Air Force) or Chief Superintendent of Police (CSP) and above who hails from the Applicant’s State of Origin.
		Duly completed Parent/Guardian Consent Form signed by Applicant’s Parent or Guardian.
		Four (4) passport photographs duly signed and stamped at the back by (c) above.
		Candidates are to bring the scratch cards of their WAEC, GCE, NECO and NABTEB results to the recruitment centres.
	
	
	Application Form is to be completed and submitted online.
	Applicant must not be bonded to any secret society or unlawful organizations.
	Any applicant suspected or confirmed to have impersonated, falsified, forged or
	presented false document(s) shall be disqualified from the Recruitment exercise and handed over to the appropriate law enforcement agency for prosecution.
	Recruitment Aptitude Test will hold on 29 November 2025.
	Successful applicants will undergo basic military training and on completion will
	be enlisted into the service of the Nigerian Navy as Ordinary Seaman
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales and Supply Driver",
  "description": "Cross Beverage Company Limited - We are a Nigerian startup producing a portfolio of affordable, daily consumed drink products. Our products positions us to meet both everyday hydration needs and the demand for flavored, wholesome beverage in the Nigerian market.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales and Supply Driver
Job Location:&nbsp;Tose - Ibadan&nbsp;- Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Safe, timely delivery of products
	Maintain and service vehicle
	Obey traffic rules &amp; company policies


Requirements


	Valid driver&rsquo;s license
	Driving experience
	Knowledge of Ibadan routes
	Responsible, punctual, trustworthy
	Good communication skills.


Salary
N40,000 - N50,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified caniddates should send their CV and Credentials to:&nbsp;humanresources@crossbeverage.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-02",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-19",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Cross Beverage Company Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {

       "postalCode": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"

Sales and Supply Driver Job at Cross Beverage Company Limited




        
    

        
        Cross Beverage Company Limited - We are a Nigerian startup producing a portfolio of affordable, daily consumed drink products. Our products positions us to meet both everyday hydration needs and the demand for flavored, wholesome beverage in the Nigerian market.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales and Supply Driver
Job Location: Tose - Ibadan - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Safe, timely delivery of products
	Maintain and service vehicle
	Obey traffic rules & company policies


Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Valid driver’s license
	Driving experience
	Knowledge of Ibadan routes
	Responsible, punctual, trustworthy
	Good communication skills.


Salary
N40,000 - N50,000 per month. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified caniddates should send their CV and Credentials to: humanresources@crossbeverage.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
